post-practice.title: quiz 1 - True or false
post-practice.content: This is the first quiz for practicing session.

post-practice.title: quiz 2 - fill in the blank
post-practice.content: This is the ________ quiz for practicing session.

post-practice.title: quiz 3 - multiple choice question
post-practice.content:
This is the ________ quiz for practicing session.

A. first

B. second

C. third

post-video1.title: quiz 1 - fill in the blank
post-video1.content: A _______ is a directed gaph G representing all the roads, but with some additional information.

post-video1.title: quiz 2 - fill in the blank
post-video1.content: Each _______ is assigned a positive real number called its capacity.

post-video1.title: quiz 3 - fill in the blank
post-video1.content: Additionally one or more vertexes labeled as a _______ , this is the place where the traffic is coming from.

post-video1.title: quiz 4 - multiple choice question
post-video1.content:
Capacity mentioned in this video's example means:

A. Weight

B. how much traffic can be handled

C. how many data can be handled

post-video1.title: quiz 5 - multiple choice question
post-video1.content:
Which of the followings is not included in the conditions needs to be satisfied when talking about flows through a network?

A. Rate Limitation.

B. The flow needs to be at most the capacity of the edge.

C. The flow out of a intersection is the same as the flow into the intersection.

post-video1.title: quiz 6 - multiple choice question
post-video1.content:
The flow (except for source and sink) into that vertex is _______ the total flow coming out of that vertex.

A. the same as

B. larger than

C.less than

post-video1.title: quiz 7 - True or false
post-video1.content: One or more vertex is labelled a sink,  which is sort of the edges of the graph where everything is going back to.

post-video1.title: quiz 8 - True or false
post-video1.content: Flow goes from sources to sink along vertexes each have a capacity.

post-video1.title: quiz 9 - True or false
post-video1.content: In the problem mentioned in the last part of this video, three graphes (A, B and C) are given and the flows in graph A is the valid flow.

post-video1.title: quiz 10 - True or false
post-video1.content: In the problem mentioned in the last part of this video, three graphes (A, B and C) are given. Graph B is invalid because it doesn't conserve flow at the denoted vertex.

post-video2.title: quiz 1 - fill in the blank
post-video2.content: We can survive only about _______ minutes without air.

post-video2.title: quiz 2 - fill in the blank
post-video2.content: A British physician by the name of ________ first proposed that humans need three macro nutrients will optimize our health.

post-video2.title: quiz 3 - fill in the blank
post-video2.content: The focus on _______ rather than food has confused many people.

post-video2.title: quiz 4 - True or false
post-video2.content: The variable in food would appear to be the nutrient.

post-video2.title: quiz 5 - True or false
post-video2.content: A basic understanding of the nutrients cannot give us a helpful background for our discussions about food.

post-video2.title: quiz 6 - True or false
post-video2.content: Simple carbohydrates include the monosaccharides, or single sugar units like glucose and fructose.

post-video2.title: quiz 7 - True or false
post-video2.content: In contrast, carbohydrates and proteins provide only five calories per gram.

post-video2.title: quiz 8 - multiple choice question
post-video2.content:
That ____ is much more complicated, it's a system.

A. food

B. nutrients

C. animal

post-video2.title: quiz 9 - multiple choice question
post-video2.content:
During the process of ________, carbohydrates are broken down and converted to glucose, which can then be metabolized by the body to produce usable energy in the form of ATP.

A. digestion

B. running

C. eating

post-video2.title: quiz 10 - multiple choice question
post-video2.content:
________ are the most energy dense storage form, providing nine calories of energy for every gram, and alcohol provides seven calories per gram.

A. proteins

B. fats

C. fruits
